qas.question: How much did Oklahoma City's population grow from 2000 to 2010?
How many people lived in Lawton in 2010?
How many people lived in Stillwater in 2010?
What Arkansas city's metro area extends into Oklahoma?

context: In descending order of population, Oklahoma's largest cities in 2010 were: <a0_0>Oklahoma City<a0_0/> (579,999, +<a1_0>14.6%<a1_0/>), Tulsa (391,906, −0.3%), Norman (110,925, +15.9%), Broken Arrow (98,850, +32.0%), Lawton (<a2_0>96,867<a2_0/>, +4.4%), Edmond (81,405, +19.2%), Moore (55,081, +33.9%), Midwest City (54,371, +0.5%), Enid (49,379, +5.0%), and Stillwater (<a3_0>45,688<a3_0/>, +17.0%). Of the state's ten largest cities, three are outside the metropolitan areas of Oklahoma City and Tulsa, and only Lawton has a metropolitan statistical area of its own as designated by the United States Census Bureau, though the metropolitan statistical area of <a4_0>Fort Smith<a4_0/>, Arkansas extends into the state.
